file_content.text: We'll make something of this rock yet.
Look sharp, men. This is what success looks like. An entire Exchange operation crushed like an insect.
May your accomplishment inspire them to do their own jobs half as well.
Excellent.
Perhaps you'll pay me now.
What? I... uh, of course. Take this with my humble thanks.
Our Empire's success reduced to a financial transaction... There you are--your work was certainly satisfactory.
Don't expect my help again.
I... will do what I can with what I'm given.
Ah, but then you'd be out of work.
Our Empire's standing will be much improved thanks to your work. Farewell.
We will show every pathetic creature on this planet what it means to defy the Empire.
Criminals and vagabonds. Everywhere on Tatooine, the Empire's great works are besieged by criminals and vagabonds.
Major Veir, sir? You have a guest.
My lord! Such an unexpected pleasure. Guided to this backwards province to bring order and discipline, no doubt.
My goals here are my own.
You presume much.
Order and discipline are hardly concerns of mine.
I'm afraid not.
Ah, but your arrival is fortuitous nonetheless, my lord.
If this is an Imperial matter, we can keep it between us, Major.
No need to involve Sith.
That's kind, agent, but I must make use of every resource.
Welcome, agent. Here to correct the dismal embarrassment this post represents, I hope.
That one is only a servant of the Empire. I am the Empire.
Such fanfare for a mere agent?
Oh, I want to correct a dismal embarrassment!
That sounds fun.
I can't discuss my mission, Major.
My work is classified.
Of course not.
If your men can't cut it, maybe you should hire a professional.
Sounds like a bad situation.
Not a bad thought.
A hired gun. Just the sort of blunt instrument required to remove the scum from this worthless planet.
Would a Sith be unacceptable for the task you describe, Major?
Better options are available.
My lord! Your involvement would honor us all.
Snuffing out lives is a passion of mine. Could I help?
Sounds like fun!
Of course, my lord! It would be a most unexpected honor.
Tell me the situation, Major. Perhaps we can keep this in-house.
No need for outside help.
I'm a professional. Treat me like one.
Show some respect.
Then you'll know a good opportunity when you see it.
Tell me what's happening here.
What's that you're blabbering?
As I was just explaining to the lazy sots in my command, the Exchange crime syndicate is flagrantly defying the Empire's directives.
They're banned by Imperial law, yet they give refuge here to dozens of murderers, spice dealers...
They've even started processing spice outside Mos Ila! And yet my men refuse to act.
But sir! We lost fifteen men in our last attempt--
Quiet! I'm well-versed in this company's many failures. Clearly, I must turn elsewhere to see Imperial law restored.
I can teach this scum to properly respect the Empire.
Leave this to me.
Excellent. A Sith will prove a powerful lesson.
There's nothing I like more than a good purge.
Why don't I take care of this?
I'm pleased that you're so... enthusiastic, my lord.
Just give me the targets and I'll take care of the rest.
I can help with that.
You want the area clean, I can make it spotless.
I can handle this for you.
Actual results! Pay attention, men.
I suppose I could help.
The job is simple. The spice processing operation outside Mos Ila must be completely obliterated, and its guards killed as a lesson.
With their men dead and machinery destroyed... the message will be clear.
I'll look forward to seeing you when it is done.
Not my problem. [Refuse quest]
Then our downward spiral continues.
Contemptible, backwards rock....
